technology.short_description: Wakhaf repelled the nomads and secured the borders. He is a peerless master of desert warfare.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Wakhaf to your faction's Lord pool (on foot with dual swords)

technology.short_description: Conquering lands beyond the mountains east of Nehekhara, Rakhash was a bringer of great prosperity.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Rakhash to your faction's Lord pool (on steed with sword and halberd )

technology.short_description: The son of Khetep ruled only briefly before his death, but his grasp of engineering and urban development were legendary.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Thutep to your faction's Lord pool (on warsphinx)

technology.short_description: Lahmizzash continued the fight against Nagash, retaking sacred Khemri with the aid of his potent Ushabti.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Lahmizzash to your faction's Lord pool (on foot with bow)

technology.short_description: Ruling in the wake of the war with Nagash, Setep restored the Necropolis and the Priesthood to their former glory.

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Setep to your faction's Lord pool (on steed with sword and staff )

technology.onscreen_name: Alkhazzar II of the Sixth Dynasty
technology.short_description: This warrior-king was unmatched in chariot tactics. Only the finest crews served under him - and will again, of course…

effects.description: Adds the Tomb King Alkhazzar II to your faction's Lord pool (on chariot with halberd and shield)

technology.short_description: Each of The Green Skulls was tortured and died in agony. Their skulls remained marred by witch-fire, the green flames of which could be seen burning within their empty eye sockets.
Known for their distinctive brightly coloured shields, the Bright Shields of Mahrak had carved out a piece in history through their many stubborn defensive stands.
Entombed in the same pyramid as King Tharruk, these warriors had loyally served their headstrong lord since the time of Alcadizaar the Conqueor
The Ushabti guard of Nagash's inner sanctum. The Sepulchrex bear the likeness of the very gods Nagash had cast down.
Symbols of the Gods, recovered from battlefields and the rubble of toppled cities, now returned to their rightful place.

effects.description: Ability: "Avatar of the Gods" for Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bow) units

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

technology.short_description: The Ushabti, fashioned after the forms of Nehekharan Gods, stand watch over the land.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Avatar of the Gods" for Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bow) units

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

technology.short_description: Ptra is the Sun-God, and first of the pantheon.
Beka of Lybaras was chosen as the architect of Khalida's tomb, which was an honour befitting his skill.
Patronage of Khetep of the Third Dynasty, bringer of prosperity.
A ruthless slave-driver, Hemiunus was famed for raising the glittering Temple of Sorrow in record time.
Sokth is the God of Thieves, Scorpions and Poison.
Patronage of Alkhazzar II of the Sixth Dynasty; he who brought Numas to heel.
Knowing precisely where to place the killing blow, Rasetra's Crocodile Squadron turned swordplay into an art form.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of Rasetra follower to your faction

items.colour_text: Knowing precisely where to place the killing blow, Rasetra's Crocodile Squadron turned swordplay into an art form.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Deathblow" for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen, Skeleton Archers and Tomb Guard units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: Entities in this unit take damage, but cannot die.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: 10% for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Tomb Guard units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

technology.short_description: Goddess Asaph was portrayed as living serpent in living Nehekhara. Now, the Mortuary Cult made sure to restore the tradition by animating serpents made of fine obsidian and marble.
When they lived, the Golden Host bore weapons made of precious metals. In death, however, they had become their namesake – by walking through pools of molten gold.
The guards of the Alabaster Tower were known to be steadfast in life, and they showed equal resolve in death.
Unleashing unending volleys of arrows, the skeleton archers bombard their foes from great distances.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Memories of the Hunt" for Skeleton Archers and Skeleton Horsemen Archers units

technology.short_description: The deadly scorpion tail is carved from stone, lacquered wood, and bone.

effects.description: Ability: "Sokth's Blessing" for Tomb Scorpion units

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

technology.short_description: Performed by liche priests of great knowledge and skill, the ceremony calls forth the Tomb Scorpions from beneath the sands.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Sokth's Blessing" for Tomb Scorpion units

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

technology.short_description: A First Dynasty master mason, Pehenna single-handedly crafted the Charnel Valley statuary.
Patronage of Queen Rasut of the Second Dynasty, exalter of the Priesthood.
Djaf is the jackal-headed God of War and Death.
Khsar is the God of the Desert and its wild winds.
Patronage of Setep of the Fifth Dynasty, restorer of the Necropolis.
Inenna the Silent oversaw the construction of Numas, the Scarab City.
The Ushabti of Djaf's Messengers fought with legendary zeal, even as the odds against them grew.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of Djaf follower to your faction

items.colour_text: The Ushabti of Djaf's Messengers fought with legendary zeal, even as the odds against them grew.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Frenzy" for Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bows) units
	(Lord's army)

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description:
Range: +25% for Ushabti (Great Bow) units
	(Lord's army)

technology.short_description: Lurking within every servant of Nagash is the essence of the dark lord himself.

effects.description:
Bound spell: "Gaze of Nagash"
	(all characters factionwide)

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Only one technology can be researched from this group, second will be locked!

technology.short_description: Though they may never draw blood, the Warrior Queen's host will end vampiric undeath.

effects.description: Number of uses: -1 for all Khalida abilities

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs single and multiple units
Requires line of sight to the target
Summons a unit of Sacred Serpents - anti-infantry necroserpents with area attacks

technology.short_description: They feel their master's hatred. It has been millennia that the great Necromancer has skulked in Nagashizzar, and his rage multiplies by the day.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +25% for all units (Rank 7 and above)
Missile damage: +25% for all units (Rank 7 and above)
Only one technology can be researched from this group, second will be locked!

technology.short_description: With nearly as much fury in undeath as in life, the carrion descend upon their victims with fierce talons ripping into living flesh.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Ualatp's Boon" for Carrion units

technology.short_description: Carved from the remains of their victims, these staves will serve the Sepulchral Stalkers well.

effects.description: Ability: "Roused Sentinels" for Sepulchral Stalkers units

technology.short_description: They lay motionless for decades, centuries, or even millennia, daring trespassers to approach.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Roused Sentinels" for Sepulchral Stalkers units

technology.short_description: Patronage of Wakhaf of the First Dynasty, subjugator of nomads.
Neru, betrothed of Ptra, is Goddess of the Moon and the 'Great Protector'.
Thutmosa's subtle artistry with chisel and mallet earned him the honour of sculpting Settra's throne.
Patronage of Lahmizzash of the Fourth Dynasty, enemy of Nagash.
Imhetop was First Hammer of Bel-Aliad, City of Dust. Every building there bore his mark.
Asaph is the Goddess of Magic and Vengeance.
With gilded bones and magically-honed blades, the Golden Host of Mahrak were the glory of the Third Dynasty.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of Mahrak follower to your faction

items.colour_text: With gilded bones and magically-honed blades, the Golden Host of Mahrak were the glory of the Third Dynasty.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Tomb Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for Tomb Guard units
	(Lord's army)

Ward Save: 10% for Hierotitan units
	(Lord's army)

technology.short_description: Tirelessly they patrol the land at Nagash's behest. Any souls, living or dead, who dare trespass soon find themselves at the mercy of these horrors.

effects.description: Causes attrition to enemy armies within your territory
Only one technology can be researched from this group, second will be locked!

technology.short_description: In a tradition dating back to ancient Nehekhara, the most skilled archer will be blessed and honoured by Asaph.
The secrets of this mastery, long hidden within the Liber Necris, have been revealed by The Supreme Lord of Undeath himself.

effects.description: Only one technology can be researched from this group, second will be locked!

technology.short_description: Slashing Khopeshes curve past enemy defenses, allowing the Nehekharan Warriors to defeat any foe.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Remembered Dexterity" for Nehekhara Horsemen and Nehekhara Warriors units

technology.short_description: Bejeweled with priceless gems and reworked with a golden lacquer, behold the splendor of Nehekhara's finest constructs!

effects.description: Ability: "Warsphinx's Roar" for Khemrian Warsphinx units

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

technology.short_description: Restored by the incantations of the liche priests, the original design of the Necrotects thrives again.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Warsphinx's Roar" for Khemrian Warsphinx units

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

technology.short_description: Ruling from the glittering capital of Khemri, Settra bound the disparate Priest Kings into the unity of single kingdom and lo, Nehekhara was born.
The Second dynasty marked a period of sweeping territorial expansion and growing prosperity for Nehekhara.
The kingdom prospered further until Nagash's treacherous rise to power, although he was finally defeated by the united Priest Kings.
In the aftermath of Nagash's reign of terror, king succeeded king in a period of great strife, division and civil war.
King Setep usurped the throne of Khemri, restoring the Priesthood and the Necropolis; from then on, Nehekhara began to flourish once more.
A resurgent Nehekhara reached its peak under Alcadizzar. Nagash returned, and after years of war, Nehekhara finally fell into decay.
Beguiling and deceptive, the Sphinx Legion of Numas caught countless foes unprepared, even in the open field.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of the Sphinx follower to your faction

items.colour_text: Beguiling and deceptive, the Sphinx Legion of Numas caught countless foes unprepared, even in the open field.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Khemrian Warsphinx units
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Large: +15 for Necrosphinx and Khemrian Warsphinx units
	(Lord's army)

technology.short_description: The envoys and harbingers of a Tomb King, bring about his benevolence… or wrath.
A place of great spiritual importance to the High Priests.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +1 for Liche High Priests

technology.short_description: Once a Necrotect of great skill, now too dessicated to serve on the battlefield. Perhaps some other use can be found for him?

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Liche High Priests

technology.short_description: So far from Khemri, the exhiles of Nehek must secure port cities to ensure their survival.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +3 for Liche High Priests

technology.short_description: A prototype elixir which could restore the Tomb Kings' bodies. Khatep must be careful not to oversell the potential of this new discovery.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +4 for Liche High Priests

technology.short_description: Such horrors await those who tread before the gaze of a Necrosphinx.
For millennia the Necrosphinxes were buried beneath the sands, only to be exhumed in the most dire of circumstances.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Nightmares Manifest" for Necrosphinx units

technology.short_description: Through the ancient Necrotect runes inscribed on your marching drums, the Unliving may be driven to march at a greater pace.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Chariot units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Chariot units

technology.short_description: This ancient Nehekharan incantation is capable of raising hosts from ‘neath the sands, fully armed and charged with the foe’s destruction.

effects.description: Charge bonus: +10 for Skeleton Horsemen and Nehekharan Horsemen units
Ammunition: +10% for Skeleton Archers and Horsemen units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Skeleton Archers and Skeleton Horsemen units

technology.short_description: A ritual supplication to the vulture-headed God of Scavengers shall ensure his spawn make reliable allies.

effects.description: Armour-piercing weapon damage: +5 for Carrion units
Speed: +25% for Dire Wolves and Fell Bats units

technology.short_description: Though long dead, kingly guardians can be reminded of their oaths of service made in ages past, invigorating them for battle.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Tomb Guard units
Melee defence: +4 for Tomb Guard units

technology.short_description: Studying the splendid cartography of the Fifth Dynasty shows you exactly where to source veteran stock.

effects.description: Ammunition: +20% for Screaming Skull Catapult and Casket of Souls units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Skull Catapult and Casket of Souls units

technology.short_description: Trinkets and ritual masks bearing Ptra's sigil are bestowed upon your stone guardians, making them fight all the harder.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Ushabti and Ushabti (Great Bows) units
Reload time reduction: +10% for Ushabti units

technology.short_description: With the Vulture-God Ualatp at their backs, the Zandri Blackshields drove their chariots with preternatural speed.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of Zandri follower to your faction

items.colour_text: With the Vulture-God Ualatp at their backs, the Zandri Blackshields drove their chariots with preternatural speed.

effects.description:
Attribute: Glorious Charge for Skeleton Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text:
When charging into an enemy unit:
	  Charge Bonus duration is doubled.
	 Enemy units take a  Leadership penalty as if they have been attacked in the flank.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% for Skeleton Chariots and Skeleton Archer Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +5 for Carrion units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for Skeleton Archer Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

Attribute: Vanguard Deployment for Skeleton Chariot units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

technology.short_description: With the Black Pyramid secured and restored to its former glory, the Great Ritual can finally begin again. Except this time, there will be no one left to stop the Undying King’s work.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -5 for Lore of Vampires spells
Miscast base chance: -100% for Lore of Vampires spells

attributes.bullet_text: This unit is unable to activate abilities or cast spells.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -10% for all legion units

technology.short_description: The followers of the Great Heretic Nagash will be returned to Usirian for judgment.

effects.description: Income from post-battle loot: +5% against Vampire Coast
Income from post-battle loot: +5% against Vampire Counts
Weapon strength: +5% when fighting against Vampires
Requires to finishing Venegance mission to unlock

technology.short_description: In Lybaras' past splendor, it was the height of Nehekharan ingenuity.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Cavalry and Chariot buildings

technology.short_description: It is said that the dead cannot know pain. Immortals, however, can be subjected to horrors that would appall the living.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +25%
Control: -2 in enemy provinces where an army is present

technology.short_description: The proud charioteers of Nehekhara smash into enemy lines, sowing terror and discord.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Noble Warriors" for Skeleton Archer Chariots and Skeleton Chariots units

technology.short_description: Armed with impossibly large ornamental armor and weapons carved of bone, the Necrolith is an inspiration to its allies.

effects.description: Ability: "Necrolith's Call" for Bone Giant units

technology.short_description: The great statues of venerated heroes have walked alongside Nehekharan armies for millennia.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Necrolith's Call" for Bone Giant units

technology.short_description: A First-Dynasty graveyard chant has been discovered, imbuing Skeleton Warriors with greater agility in battle.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Chariot units
Melee defence: +4 for Nehekhara Warriors, Skeleton Warriors, Skeleton Spearmen and Chariot units

technology.short_description: Raising elite riders and their steeds from Second Dynasty nomadic battle sites bolsters your cavalry forces.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Skeleton Horsemen and Nehekhara Horsemen units
Melee defence: +4 for Skeleton Horsemen and Nehekhara Horsemen units

technology.short_description: It is said that a drop of purest venom, placed upon the lips of the sacrificial victim, will rouse the Scorpion-God himself.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Tomb Scorpion units
Melee defence: +4 for Tomb Scorpion units

technology.short_description: If they can disregard their former rivalries and toil together in common cause, Necrotects can achieve engineering wonders.
A burnt offering, combined with the correct ritual address, brings great dexterity to a Necropolis Knight's mount.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Necropolis Knights units
Melee defence: +4 for Necropolis Knights units

technology.short_description: Forbidden scrolls found in the deep desert reveal portals to Usirian’s realm. This is where the Necrosphinx lurk, awaiting to be tethered to a dread statue.
The arrows of the Hawk Legion of Khemri always found their mark at necks, groins and the tiniest chinks in enemy armour.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of Khemri follower to your faction

items.colour_text: The arrows of the Hawk Legion of Khemri always found their mark at necks, groins and the tiniest chinks in enemy armour.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Hawkish Precision" for Skeleton Archers, Skeleton Archer Chariots, Ushabti (Great Bows) and Bone Giant units
	(Lord's army)

enabled_if: No enemy presence in ability range

effects.description:
Ammunition: +10% for Skeleton Archers units
	(Lord's army)

technology.short_description: Arkhan's dark magic infused with the power of this great pyramid allows him to strengthen all of the abominations under his command.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 10% for all vampiric units
Weapon strength: +10% for all vampiric units

technology.short_description: With the greatest port city of Nehekhara under his control, Arkhan dispatches vampiric emissaries to secure allies overseas.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +100 with Vampire Coast and Vampire Counts
Recruit rank: +2 for all vampiric units

technology.short_description: Powerful glyphs array the surface of Ka-Sabar, concealing great magics within their ancient designs.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve: +2 per turn

technology.short_description: Taken from the carcasses of defeated armies and the rubble of burning cities, these relics could bring about the Age of Awakening.

effects.description: Construction time: -10% for Ancient Kingdom buildings

technology.short_description: These terrifying scales are built to weigh a soul and determine the measure of a life.

effects.description: Ability: "Journey from the Underworld" for Hierotitan units

technology.short_description: The Sun God's wrath is awesome and terrible to behold.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Journey from the Underworld" for Hierotitan units

technology.short_description: Lacking the painstaking mummification lavished upon the nobility, these warriors have, through an aeon of death-sleep, been desiccated into indefatigable loyalty.
Construction scrolls have been disinterred, making it possible to improve certain units’ weapons and armour.
These war-statues exhude timeless sophistication, in stark contrast to their ghoulish, blood-slicked ornamentation.
As posited by Rakaph III, bone makes both an effective weapon and surprisingly durable armour for Undead warriors.

effects.description: Armour: +15 for Skeleton Archers and Horsemen units
Melee attack: +4 for Bone Giant units
Missile strength: +10% for Skeleton Archers and Horsemen units
Ward save: 5% for Bone Giant units

technology.short_description: The mere presence of a mortuary disciple in the mausolean stillness bestirs the desert-dwelling husks, from the scavengers of Uulatp to the swarms of Sokth.
Mortuary Cult devotees know all about the most fruitful burial grounds. Assigned to garrison, such knowledge is invaluable.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Sepulchral Stalkers units
Melee defence: +4 for Sepulchral Stalkers units

technology.short_description: Radiant idols are sculpted to allow the hierophant inside to conjoin the mortal world with the Realm of Souls, lending power to funereal incantations.
With minor adjustments to everyday incantations, the dead may be made to rise with greater vigour than they ever knew in life.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Tomb Guard and Hierotitan units
Weapon strength: +10% for Tomb Guard and Hierotitan units

technology.short_description: Gaze now in despair at the coils of the column that rises from the red-hot sand. Crowned by baleful orbs, they gleam with the eddying hues of sombre iris.
Fifth Dynasty scrolls show the locations of Necroserpent nests, where the beasts sit coiled beneath the sands, on a bed of howling skulls.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Necropolis Knights units
Missile strength: +10% for Skull Catapult and Casket of Souls units

technology.short_description: Imbued with the undying will of Nehekhara's kings, the sacred war-statuary grant a measure of their stone-like resilience and ceaseless vigilance to the legions.
Huge Sixth Dynasty gold reserves have been recovered - perfect for ornamenting our most prestigious edifices.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for Khemrian Warsphinx units

technology.short_description: Blessed by Sokth himself, the Scorpion Guard could shrug off mortal blows and carve through infantry with horrifying efficiency.

effects.description: Grants the Herald of the Scorpion follower to your faction

items.colour_text: Blessed by Sokth himself, the Scorpion Guard could shrug off mortal blows and carve through infantry with horrifying efficiency.

effects.description:
Bonus vs Infantry: +15 for Tomb Scorpion units
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 10% for Bone Giant units
	(Lord's army)

technology.short_description: Audaciously designed to rival Settra's palace in Khemri, the white marble interior is intricately designed and well warded. The architect's fate is unknown.

effects.description: Construction time: -2 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: Imperishable indeed. All these Tomb Kings will bow before the new King of Kings!

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Tomb Kings
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Tomb Kings
Income from post-battle loot: +25% against Tomb Kings

technology.short_description: With the Scarab City now under our control, we will utilize its latent magics to bolster our forces.

effects.description: Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
Casualty replenishment rate: +10% for all vampiric units

technology.short_description: With Qu'aph's blessing the Necropolis Knights revel in unrestrained slaughter.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Champions' Souls" for Necropolis Knights and Necropolis Knights (Halberds) units

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.

technology.short_description: The curses laid upon this casket are too horrible for mortal words; the hieroglyphs may only be intoned by the Keeper of the Casket.

effects.description: Ability: "Unseal the Sarcophagus" for Casket of Souls units

technology.short_description: With every volley, more souls are claimed by the casket, increasing its strength.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Unseal the Sarcophagus" for Casket of Souls units

technology.short_description: March, my legions - plant the seeds of civilisation upon the lands of Nehek!

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Infantry and Chariot buildings

technology.short_description: From the sands come steed and shadow - the desert stables open to the gallop of death!

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Cavalry and Chariot buildings

technology.short_description: Make ready our cities - build upon strong foundations so they stand the test of time!

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

technology.short_description: Defend your kingdom and attack the weak. Glory is in victory at all costs.

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Wall, Garrison, Citadel and Estate buildings
Income from sacking and looting settlements: +10%

technology.short_description: From the deserts the great shrines arise; larger and taller to withstand the winds of time and the usurpers of nascent kingdoms!

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for income, growth and public order buildings

technology.short_description: And the might of Nehekhara shall be unleashed - magic coils and the legions rise!

effects.description: Construction cost: -10% for Construct recruitment buildings
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

technology.short_description: These wardings are placed in areas of strategic significance and woven into the armour of the most revered legions.
A relatively new development for the Mortuary Cult, these rituals rapidly restore Nehekharan armies to full strength.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +10%
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

technology.short_description: Discovered deep within the forbidden scroll, this intricate incantation can only be performed by the most proficient liche priests.
With the help of his most trusted High Priests, Khatep places defensive enchantments on entire legions.

effects.description: Ward save: 5% when in foreign territory

technology.short_description: The invention – and macabre opulence – of Nehekharan war chariots swelled their hosts, for it was deemed indecorous for highborn blood to touch the brutish draught beasts.
Even in Undeath, the nomads of the arid wastes enjoy the freedom conferred by the tyrants of old, in return for answering the dynasty's summons.
Through a gruelling redoubling of effort, incantations that rekindle the inanimate shell can tip a soul from the very scales of the God of the Underworld.
Clad in morbid regalia and with ceremonial arms at the ready, the king's elite emerge from their upright sarcophagi to serve their rancorous sovereign.
The grim custodians of these bone-woven catapults are not perturbed by gurgling pleas seeping from the cadavers nailed to their masts – quite the opposite, in fact!
Be they sentries of the inner sanctums enshrined in vast lycea or superstitiously-interred in the deepest desert chasms, these mythical colossi are difficult to disentomb.
